alert.note: Alert for Marion; Monongalia; Preston; Ridges of Eastern Monongalia and Northwestern Preston (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:32AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN MONONGALIA... NORTHWESTERN PRESTON AND EAST CENTRAL MARION COUNTIES THROUGH NOON EDT... At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westover, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Westover, Kingwood, Star City, Granville, Brookhaven, Cassville, Rivesville, Reedsville, Masontown, Booth, Everettville, Laurel Run, Cheat Lake, Crown, Gladesville, Osage, Browns Chapel, and Georgetown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 22. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 140 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Marion; Monongalia; Preston; Ridges of Eastern Monongalia and Northwestern Preston
